item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
#numerical_integration #recursive_functions
#numerical_integration #recursive_functions
Using numerical integration methods to develop a generic algorithm for performing double and multiple integration on an input function.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
Fitting 2D potential or vector fields to data.


Electrostatic vector field generated by 3 source charges. Additionally plot the electrostatic vector field.

Similar to Project 3 - 2021, but with 4 source charges.

4 source charges.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
#curve_fitting
#curve_fitting
This requires students to construct composite functions from a set of base functions to fit to various spectra (traditionally from radioactive sources).

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
#numerical_integration
#numerical_integration


Water rocket. Vertical acceleration recorded. Error estimation and uncertainty propagation used. Maximum heights of multiple rockets determined and compared within expanded uncertainty intervals.
Note the "improved" version of this project, which is a re-write including material from the help sessions.
Note that due to an error in the initial solutions, the uncertainties are impractically small.

Two wheeled RC vehicle. Comparing path reconstruction from horizontal linear + rotational acceleration and rpm for each wheel.

Ball rolling down a slope, with x and y acceleration data recorded. Reconstruct slopes.

Water rocket. Vertical acceleration recorded.

item.title: Monte Carlo Integration
item.description:
#random #uncertainty
#random #uncertainty
Integrating by using the dart-board approach.
Use multiple sample sets to determine uncertainty estimation.


Estimate PI and then adapt to generic integration.

Generic integration.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
#ODE_solving #root_finding
#ODE_solving #root_finding
In this method a boundary value problem is solved by converting it to an initial value problem by introducing a variable initial condition. A root finding method is used to determine the value for this initial value which gives a solution for the boundary value problem.
This requires students to be able to think about using the ODE solver to generate a function.


2 point BVP eigenvalue problem.

Used to solve a generic 2 point BVP, with fixed values.

Used to solve a generic 2 point BVP, with fixed values.

Lane-Emden equation. Initial conditions are known, the position of the right boundary must be found.

item.description:

Calculate the Fourier series of a function and plot it alongside the function.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
#curve_fitting #chi_squared

Given a few unmatched data sets and possible models, find the models that best fits each data set based on the chi squared value of each fit.

Integrate data sets using Trapezoidal and Simpsons. Compare the results using known integral values.

Sort methods in order of min error.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
Solve the ODEs for a physical system where the total energy can be determined, and use the energy over time as an indicator of numerical error.
Sometimes introduce the effects of an external force - such as dampening.


Pendulum. Comparing Euler solution to small angle approx.

Pendulum. Comparing Euler and RK4 to each other and to the small angle approximation.

Same as Tutorial 5 - 2021, but with different parameters.

Bob and spring. Spring dampening added later.

Bob and spring.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
ODE problems where physical conditions cause a piecewise defined ODE function.


Pendulum above a liquid.

Pendulum above a liquid.

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
Using the final root bracket to determine the error, compare the root estimates to the true value.


Two questions. The focus is not solely on using the error estimate.

Find the root estimate given a specified number of iterations.

Find the root estimate given a specified tolerance.

Using a range of iterations.

Comparing each root finding method directly.

Also comparing convergence.
item.guid: Tutorials/Root Finding/Compare Numerical Root Estimate to True Root Within Error.md

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
Show the convergence of each root finding technique by estimating the root for a range of iterations and comparing it to the true value.



Along with using the error estimates.
item.guid: Tutorials/Root Finding/Convergence of Root Finding Estimates.md

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description: This tutorial may be too conceptually strange, and goes against the main concern of numerical methods being precision.
item.guid: Tutorials/Root Finding/Rounding Off as Convergence Condition.md

item.title: Uses and Variation
item.description:
Determine a root finding algorithm given a target precision.


Determine a tolerance to achieve the given precision. Note that this is defunct as it isn't correct.
item.guid: Tutorials/Root Finding/Target Precision of Root Estimate.md

item.title: Uses and Variations
item.description:
Implement the root finding methods within a target tolerance.
Note that this is the subject of exercise questions now, so shouldn't be used going forward.


Note, this also compares the result to a known value within an error interval.
item.guid: Tutorials/Root Finding/Target Tolerance for Root Estimate.md

Earth
